metadata.title: CVE-2015-5313 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low
metadata.description:
Directory traversal vulnerability in thevirStorageBackendFileSystemVolCreate function instorage/storage_backend_fs.c in libvirt, when fine-grained Access ControlLists (ACL) are in effect, allows local users with storage_vol:create ACLbut not domain:write permission to write to arbitrary files via a .. (dotdot) in a volume name.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-5313` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libvirt-bin - 1.2.2-0ubuntu13.1.16
libvirt0 - 1.2.2-0ubuntu13.1.16
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvirt package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.2.2-0ubuntu13.1.16').
